H0.text: Motion is the subject of Newton’s second law, which is more than a definition; it is a relationship among acceleration, force, and mass.

H1.text: Newton’s second law of gravity is more than a definition; it is a relationship among acceleration, force, and mass.

H2.text: Change is Newton’s second law of what; it is more than a definition and is a relationship among acceleration, force, and mass.

H3.text: Interference is Newton’s second law of what is more than a definition; it is a relationship among acceleration, force, and mass.

A4.text: By inserting such an expression for F into Newton's second law, an equation with predictive power can be written.

A5.text: The change of motion of an object is proportional to the force impressed; and is made in the direction of the straight line in which the force is impressed.
